Posts.Content: hi Susan When i found out i was stage 3 bc i worried about telling my dad, he is 80.. He also lives four and a half hours away and i knew he wouldnt be able to see me unless someone picked him up. I had to phone him and believe it or not he was alot calmer than i thought he would be.I think i cried more then he did. Telll your mom she might surprise you.My dad was my greatest  supporter. One thing he said to me was that as a parent it was his worst nightmare but he beleived in me and knew i was a fighter. Good luck to you i hope i helped.Just remember that we as parents love uncondtionaly and when our children are at their weakest we become stronger . Im sure your mom will be ok. i know as our parents get older we worry about what to tell them but they are our parents and they need to know
Posts.Title: how to tell my mother

Posts.Content: On 1/2/2008 sheena56 wrote: I am a 51 year old, 4 year survivor of BC, stage 1; treated with lumpectomy, radiation, 2.5 yrs tamoxifen, currently in second year of Arimidex. I recently had some spotting (not like a regular period) and the gyno did D&C and biopsy which came back okay. He recommended I do 4 months of Lupron, and I have had the second shot. The first month wasn't too bad, but now I'm starting to have some pretty uncomfortable side effects: hot flashes, night sweats, anxiety and depression being the worst. My blood work shows that I am menopausal and have been since beginning the Arimidex nearly 2 years ago. I am considering not going ahead with the next 2 Lupron shots. I feel I have been very fortunate so far...my cancer was caught early and the treatments to date have been very tolerable. I don't want to risk a reoccurrence, but I hate feeling this way.  Has anyone else taken this combination of drugs? How have your side effects been? Any info is greatly appreciated. I have been taking lupron and arimidex since completing my chemo and radiation. I was stage 3 with a complete mastectomy. i can understand your frustration with hot flashes night sweats and all those other terrible side affects.  i have been taking both drugs since 2006. I can tell you that the hot flashes and night sweats only last me for about 2 weeks after the injection, but when things get real hot i use a fan that i got and keep on my side of the bed this seems to work.I also have ice packs that i use if things get real hot. Please just remember that you are not alone and as bad as things get for me with feeling depressed i embrase the day and than  count my blessings. i too, wish there was another way but my goal is to keep the cancer away so lupron and armidex are my only hope for now.hope this helped  .
Posts.Title: Lupron and Arimidex

Posts.Content: hi kimbersue   there are many organizations that im sure will help. ask to speak with the social worker from the cancer center. ask her what programs the center offers. also the Knights of Columbus  in you area might help. When i was going through my treatments  the knights offered help. I was able to decline so that they might help someone else. also if your community has volanteer fire and rescue squads approach them. Tell them about her condition and ask if they would be willing to hold an event such as a tricky tray, golf outing, spagetti dinner, special dinner dance or even a steak and beer bust(this brings in alot of money where i live).  Im sure they will do something to help.Also approach the pta at the school where her children go ask them if the would hold a fundraiser . its ok to reach out to her community  youll be surprised at the response. I have been a volenteer on our local rescue squad for 21 years and we are always helping with  peolpe such as this. I hoped i helped. Your friend is lucky to have you I hope the best for her. laborerlady
Posts.Title: fund raiser for friend with breast cancer, and ideas?

Posts.Content: On 3/1/2008 Abrina wrote: I'm thinking about having a breast lift done on my unaffected breast so it matches my affected one more.  That is if I can afford it.  Has any one done this?  Does it cost less having one breast done and than two?  I'm curious.   Thanks,    just for your information Federal law says insurance companys have to pay for reconstruction and also surgeries to make your breast the same. i have been going through my reconstruction and my breast lift is covered. speak to your insurace carrier if they say no ask them about the federal law i did .good luck to you   laborerlady
Posts.Title: breasts lift?

Posts.Content: i was stage 3 also with chemo and radiation in 2005. I had a tram flap in 2006. this is where they take your abdominal mussel and make a breast the surgery took about 8 hours. It was very invasive as you get a tummy tuck  too,but my recovery  was about three months. once done you than have a breast reduction on your other breast and than you get a nipple that is tatooed. i am very pleased with the outcome i think it was well worth it. Just remember there are many options out there .you must pick what is right for you. Best of luck to you in what ever you choose.                        Kathy K
Posts.Title: reconstruction after chemo /radiation

Posts.Content: just want you to know i hada tram flap and then went for some pt  I wish you the best. glad i could share hope it helped
Posts.Title: post mastectomy pain syndrome

Posts.Content: ive had a port in since 2005 ,i must tell you that it has never bothered me. sounds like somthing isnt right.  ask your dr to take a look. does it flush ok? i go every 4 to 6 weeks and have it flushed and have my blood work done. this is the only time it gets aliitle sore. there are though many different types of ports so i dont know what yours is but, if it bothers you be persistent and have it checked     laborerlady
Posts.Title: port installed hurts

Posts.Content: thank you donnalynn.Im glad to here your son is doing well. I hope my son turns the corner soon. Im glad to know im not the only one who is going through this thanks for your support
Posts.Title: how do i get my son back

Posts.Content: thank you suzie you dont know how much your words mean to me. I will never give up on him . It does help knowing others have been through the same  thing maybe time will help
Posts.Title: how do i get my son back

Posts.Content: Ihad the same pain i know how terrible it can be but i must tell you that once i had my reconstuction the pain went away and now i only have mild pain on occasion, not everyday like i had
Posts.Title: post mastectomy pain syndrome

Posts.Content: hi everyone              I was diagnosed may 2005 with stage 3 bc, as we all know this is the worst thing we can be told. I  am a fighter so i accepted  my cancer as was ready to fight. My husband was great as well as my daughter,but my son took the news really bad. He  and I were very close but after finding out I had cancer he withdrew himself from my life. He still lives at home but keeps his distants from me. When I was going through my treatments he very rarely came in my room to see how I was and when I had my breast removed he only came to the hospital after my surgery. The worst thing is that he has become an  alcholic and a drug user. This is killing me. All we do is fight and when ever I say anthing  He tells me that this is my fault. His dad and I have offered him rehab but hes says he is fine,but when he gets in trouble he calls us to fix things. My son was a loving caring person who never left the house without kissing me good bye and telling me he loved me I so want that back but I dont know what to do.I blame my cancer on destroying this loving man .He is 25 and  i am so afraid that he is going to  kill himself with drugs and alchol  I just am at my wits end .Any Advice?
Posts.Title: how do i get my son back

Posts.Content: Thank you for  sharing your story with me. I am sorry for your loss. Yes there are family members he can speak with but my cancer is off  limits to speak about. Im glad you were able to come to terms with your dads illness and be with him at the end. I pray everyday my son will come around. I thank you
Posts.Title: how do i get my son back

Posts.Content: i too was stage 3 breast cancer with 3 affected nodes. it was may of 2005.i had my breast removed also. I had chemo and 25 radiation treatments.Im doing fine.I also had a tumor that was 6 in size. I know hearing stage 3 is frighting but i have learned not to worry. People with stage 3 have done very well with treament and lived very long lives. Have you mom ask her oncoligist to explain the different stages and also her prognosis. My dr doesnt seem worried about my stage he says my chance of it coming back after treament is about 20%. I wish your mom the best.tell her to keep positive, have her treatments and live life to the fullest.We must remember that no one is promised tomorrow, having cancer only makes us more aware of  living for today           .
Posts.Title: Survival.. confused about prognosis

Posts.Content: hi terri    to answer your question  yes i had this done when i went for surgery. The dye was injected ans then i had a scan to watch where the dye was going it took about one hour prior to surgery. I was stage 3 with 3 nodes pos.i wish you sister the best   kathy
Posts.Title: My sister just found out

Posts.Content: On 9/12/2008 jennyfur wrote: Hi Everyone, I've been reading a lot from the message board but have not heard anyone mention getting injections of lupron every 3 months for 2 yrs. along with tamoxafin as a way of avoiding reacurrance of breast cancer. I had the oncotype test that came back inconclusive so chemo. wasn't recommended by my Dr. If anything she said that americans tend to be a little chemo. happy when there are much more alternatives now. I would love to hear what other people's responses to this are! Jennyfur     hi jennyfur       I HAVE BEEN USING LUPRON FOR TWO YEARS NOW. I ALSO TAKE ARIMEDEX. I MUST TAKE THIS FOR 5 YEARS. AS FOR SIDE AFFECTS THERE ARE MANY BUT I SEEM TO MANAGE. I DO WHAT IM TOLD AS I DONT WANT MY CANCER TO RETURN.UNLIKE YOU I DID HAVE CHEMO AND RADIATION TOO.
Posts.Title: Lupron

Posts.Content: Well today is another sad day for me. My friend who was a sister of breast cancer was layed to rest. For me this is just a reminder that there are no promises of tomorrow and that we all must embrase each day and live life to the fullest.  Dawn was her name and she fought a good battle.So, for her I  will  embrase my cancer and thank god for each day of health he gives me. I will do as she did and i will control my cancer and not allow it to contol me
Posts.Title: another passing of a sisiter

Posts.Content: i had a tram  myself and yes i knew going into surgery that my breast would be smaller. I am having breast reduction in my other breast my  doctor explained this to me before surgery.   he also explained that my breast is made from muscle and if i was to loose weight i would also loose in my tram. sorry your not happy, but im sure it can be fixed. i welcome my reductionj as i am 51 and my breast is falling i welcome a lift  good luck to you.
Posts.Title: tram flap surgery
